etymology.description: 玆 is a variant form of 茲(茲) (zī, "this") -> interchangeable in certain contexts
etymology.interpretation: 玆 and 茲 share the same pronunciation and meaning, serving as variants of each other. Both forms are used interchangeably depending on context and orthographic tradition.

examples.chinese: 玆物虽微(玆物雖微)，情谊无穷(情誼無窮)。
examples.pinyin: zī wù suī wēi, qíng yì wú qióng
examples.english: This object may be small, but the affection is boundless.

examples.chinese: 玆日清闲(玆日清閒)，心情舒畅(心情舒暢)。
examples.pinyin: zī rì qīng xián, xīn qíng shū chàng
examples.english: This day is leisurely, and the mood is relaxed.
